intro: Heliocarpus cuspidatus, commonly known as the Brazilian chestnut or red sand-wood, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, fibrous wood and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are hard, woody capsules that contain several seeds. Heliocarpus cuspidatus is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
